I’m so excited for my sister’s wedding next month! Since I’m her matron of honor, that means I’ll be ... admittedly, I haven’t been too good to my skin lately. So the last time I visited my dermatologist, she recommended CeraVe skincare products. I’ve recently started using CeraVe Moisturizing Cream, CeraVe Hydrating Cleanser, CeraVe Foaming Facial Cleanser, CeraVe AM Facial Moisturizing Lotion, and CeraVe Sunscreen Face Lotion SPF 50. I found all of these products at Walmart, in the ‘Dermatologist Recommended’ section of the skincare aisle.

Our skin naturally contains ceramides, and over time, they get depleted, leading to dry and irritated skin. CeraVe helps replenish the vital ceramides healthy skin needs. So I’ve been using all of these products on a daily basis ... and fragrance-free, and most are also non-comedogenic! You need healthy products to get healthy skin, right?! I’ve developed my own CeraVe skincare routine that I follow every day to improve my skin’s surface and tone.
Check out my five step tutorial:
Step 1

In the morning, I start off by washing my face with CeraVe Hydrating Cleanser. This creamy cleanser quickly lathers up on my face and has ceramides and hyaluronic acid which moisturize, soften, ... love it because it wakes me up in the morning!

Step 2

After rinsing off the Hydrating Cleanser, I smooth CeraVe AM Facial Moisturizing Lotion all over my face. It’s a lightweight moisturizer that moisturizes (of course), and also provides broad ... that in a few steps). And of course, it acts as a great base for my makeup application.

Step 3

CeraVe Moisturizing Cream is also great for the face but since I use the AM Facial Moisturizing Lotion on my face, ... and uses ceramides to help restore the protective skin barrier.
Step 4

Next, I slather on a light layer of CeraVe Sunscreen Face Lotion SPF 50 on both my face and neck. I pay particular attention to adding sunscreen to the ... go!

Step 5

At the end of the day, I wash my face once again – this time using my CeraVe Foaming Facial Cleanser. This cleanser starts off as a silky, clear gel and quickly lathers up once you add water. ... and oil from the day, while replenishing my skin with ceramides.

A non-foaming cleanser that removes dirt, oil, and makeup while moisturizing, softening, and repairing ... actually a gentle emulsifying agent that’s extracted from canola oil and gives skin a soft powdery touch.
Overall Experience
The CeraVe Hydrating Cleanser pretty much checks off everything I look for in a cleanser, and then some. It’s affordable, pH balanced, ... skin doesn’t like fatty alcohol, I would avoid this cleanser. Personally I’ve had no problems whatsoever, but YMMV.

Cerave Healing Ointment NEW! CeraVe® Healing Ointment is the first and only healing ointment with a non-greasy feel that combines the ideal ratio of three essential ceramides (1, 3 & 6-II) with other key hypo-allergenic ingredients in a non-comedogenic and lanolin-free formula.
Cerave Healing Ointment

CeraVe® Healing Ointment helps protect, soothe, and relieve extremely dry chapped and chafed skin. Developed with some of the country’s leading dermatologists over a three year period, CeraVe® Healing Ointment provides intense, long-lasting moisturization, even to eczema prone skin. Petrolatum, the active ingredient in healing ointments comprises 46.5% of the formula, compared to the leading brand that contains 41%.
Unlike the leading brand, CeraVe® Healing Ointment has been accepted by the National Eczema Association and does not contain lanolin. In fact, 9 out of 10 ointment users say they would switch from their current brand to new CeraVe® Healing Ointment.1 CeraVe® Healing Ointment features a unique blend of mineral waxes such as ozokerite and paraffin, along withdimethicone, and hyaluronic acid.
